page.title: 07SAMSON FOX. 1831-1903.
page.content: {Sansom Fox}was born in Leeds in 1831 and later owned{Leeds Forge}which made pressed steel, underframes and bogies for railway rolling stock. In 1881 he bought{Grove hHouse} from the Greenwoods of Swarcliffe Hall and immediately set about enlarging and altering the house, a tall grim grey building which looked towards a heathy common later to become the{Stray.}No expence was spared for his new home. He was Mayor of Harrogate on three occasions and did much to promote its' prosperity as a Spa. A plaque at the north end of the Stray near Skipton Road commemorates his roasting of an ox on the{Diamond Jubilee of Queen {Victoria.}He died in 1903.
